title: Health Discourse Research Initiative
snippet: This page mentions Fabio Giglietto's involvement in the Health Discourse Research Initiative, specifically his work on identifying coordinated link-sharing networks on Facebook, focusing on health information in Nigeria and India.
description: The Health Discourse Research Initiative page mentions Fabio Giglietto's work on identifying coordinated link-sharing networks on Facebook related to health information in Nigeria and India.

title: “META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS”
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which demonstrated how Meta favored homophobic, racist, or fake news posts at the expense of content from politicians, influencing elections worldwide.
description: This YouTube video discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino regarding Meta's promotion of problematic content, influencing elections worldwide.

title: Facebook premia gli estremisti: la ricerca dell'Università di Urbino - Lumsanews

Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme - Open
snippet: An article discussing a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which analyzes how Meta's algorithmic choices affect the distribution and visibility of political content on its platforms, noting transparency deficits where algorithmic suppression is less effective against extremists. The study analyzed over 2.5 million Facebook posts between 2021 and 2025.
description: This article discusses a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino about the impact of Meta's algorithms on political content, highlighting issues of transparency and the potential amplification of extremist viewpoints.

title: Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Cambio di Rotta - Cap3: La Fluidità del Voto in Italia 2022 - Studocu
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
Meet the speakers! - EUDTP 2025 - EuroTech Universities Alliance
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, researching disinformation dynamics and examining the spread and societal impact of false narratives across digital platforms. He analyzes computational methods for detecting coordinated manipulation campaigns and offers evidence-based approaches to counter harmful information operations. He is also listed as giving a talk regarding implementation challenges and opportunities under DSA.
description: This webpage promotes the EuroTech Universities Alliance Digital Technologies and Policy Conference 2025, featuring Fabio Giglietto as a speaker. He is identified as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo who researches disinformation dynamics and discusses implementation challenges and opportunities under the DSA.

title: Meta shuts down CrowdTangle tool used by some groups to track online misinformation
snippet: Dr. Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor of internet studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo in Italy, anticipates disappointment from researchers regarding the shutdown of CrowdTangle. He notes the difficulties with the alternative tool, particularly for those who navigated the complex application process.
description: This article discusses the shutdown of Meta's CrowdTangle tool and quotes Dr. Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor of internet studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, regarding the impact on researchers studying online misinformation.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article interviews Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo about their role in the VERAAI project. They coordinate Work Package 4 (WP4), which focuses on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior through social media analysis and network science methods. Giglietto discusses the challenges of disinformation analysis, including the evolving tactics and the potential threat of large language models. He also notes the increasing collaboration among scholars and professionals to combat disinformation.
description: The article interviews Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo about their work on the VERAAI project, specifically focusing on disinformation analysis and social media research, which aligns with his area of expertise.
